review: Quite simple here... I've never been here but I think when I'm in the area, I will partake in the burger heaven that is Red Robin. I had the Burnin' Love Burger and it was a nice not-too-spicy burger.  I love the addition of the deep fried jalapeno coins! The dessert was off the charts!  I asked for the Nestle Toll House Cookie Sandwich and the waitress said it would be a 7 minute wait as the cookie is made fresh to order!!  Can you say WELL WORTH THE WAIT!!

Really enjoyed our first time at this location. The service was great, with our server being really sweet, attentive, and friendly. She made sure our drinks were always full. I had the fish and chips, and they were pipping hot and delicious. My two sons had the kids menu fare and also enjoyed their meals.

This is the 2nd tme that I have visited  this RR.  The restaurant is well lit and comfortable.  They make a very good burger and the bottomless fries are a nice touch.  When I was being seated I overheard the manager apologizing to the people, at the next table, for some type of mix-up.  This did not instill confidence in me, that my visit was going to be a good one, right from the start.  I asked the person, who was taking our drink order, what beers they had, on tap, that were either microbrews or imports and she told me they had Miller, Bud, Sam Adams and then had to refer me to the menu for others. I would expect a server to know what is at the bar and on the menu. Not so here.  I was also priviledged to be able to watch 3 employees sitting at a booth chatting during business hours. Two of which were groping each another. Obviously boyfriend / girlfriend. The manager was completely oblivious as he walked by them several times. Not exactly what I wanted to see when eating my meal.  There was one server who was wiping off the lights, over the tables, right next to people who were eating their meals. VERY unsanitary.   It doesn't matter, how good the food is, if the service, atmosphere, and management are not up to standard. I'll take my business elsewhere from now on.

First time visit.  Staff was friendly.  Onion rings were good.  Beverage of Ice Tea had no ice.  Choice of burger wasn't good.  Toasted bread made the burger harder to bite into.  The fried Jalapeno's on the burger and pepper gave the burger some heat.  Not alot of seasoning for taste.  Steak fries with burger was really good.  The center side items made the burger cold.  Will try the place again to try something different.
Solid burgers and fries.  Clean inside.  Comfortable.  Good Service.  Reasonable beer prices.  Yay! I'm a fan.

The food here is very good, my favorite being the Royal Red Robin Burger. The server here is pretty slow when the place is super packed but if you come on a night where all the tables aren't filled then everything is super fast.

What can I say just ok... burgers are just ok and the Lincolnshire location is much better for some reason. Steak fries are amazing but eh main issue here and the reason for the low review is that I have been there five times now and the service every time but once has been just horrible... very slow....

Service was great, waitress was very efficient. Ordered a burger with fries and found a little tin foil by my fries. Manager came out, apologized, and took my meal off the bill. The burger was great too.

I visited Red Robin for the first time over the weekend.  The staff and service was great.  I had the Oktoberfest burger and bottomless fries. The burger was good but the swiss cheese wasn't a hit. The toasted pretzel bun was good and it absorbs moisture very well, so the bread doesn't get soggy like regular burger buns. I took some home with me because it was huge. The fries were good and I was able to season them to my liking.  Ordered the Raspberry Limeade to quench my thirst. So good! I had like 2 refills. I'd def would visit again.

We noted that three groups of people were seated in the waiting area when we arrived, though there were at least six empty tables that were immediately visible; evidence of short staffing. The hostess advised us that there would be a ten to fifteen minute wait to be seated unless we cared to be seated at their "full service bar". We opted for bar seating.   We sat at the center of the bar for five minutes, and were passed by the bartender at least three times before he as much as acknowledged our presence, after he paused to look at the televised football game directly in front of us, turn around and offer his opinion to patrons seated at the end of the bar. THEN the bartender acknowledged us and asked for our drink order. We were handed menus after our beverages were served, and waited another five minutes after we decided what to order and put our menus down on the bar and away from us. Our food was served by a waitress about 7 minutes after we placed our order, though we had to wait a few minutes more for the bartender to cease filling drink orders, so we may ask him for napkins and dining utensils (specifically, a knife to cut our burgers in half).  The bartender disappeared as we were finishing our meal, so we had to distract a floor manager who was engaged in assigning staff to tables for the upcoming dinner hour to get our tab. He plopped it in front of us, and also disappeared.  We had to flag down a random waiter after we waited five minutes, to hand him our credit card and pay our bill.  This was our first visit to Red Robbin and it likely will be our last. While our burgers and fries tasted good (for $8.99 each they should), they still were not worth the hassle that we encountered. We can get a burger on par with Red Robin's elsewhere, be treated as if our presence matters, and as though our business is appreciated.

Stopped  by at about 7:30pm, hardly a busy time for this restaurant. The over worked waitress got to us, we ordered basic burgers, done medium. It took 25 minutes to get the order out, and they were just about raw. Finally, our waitress came back to "see how the food was tasting". By that time, we got a reorder to go. The manager got involved, apologized profusely, and took two of the three burgers off our bill and gave us a nice gift card. This has happened to us several times here, maybe its just us? The endless fries were nice, but never got more, so for us they were not so endless. One refill on the water (is it that hard to check back on your table a time or two???) The burgers are just average, as is the rest of the menu. We will not be back.
Excellent burgers, great menu but the Food takes too long to cook and waiters don't come around very often. Great burgers, mediocre service.

Red Robin - YUMMM! This place is great.   Best hamburgers and friendly service. Love the BBQ Whiskey River burger, but I like to try a different one each time I go.  Try the tower of onion rings.  My nieces also love this place - it is kid friendly. TIP:  If you are a frequent customer, join the Red Royalty rewards club - it's free.

Let me start by saying I loves me a burger, and Red Robin does great burgers. The reason the rating is so poor is two-fold - (a) the calories, and (b) the service. Read on, oh-those-of-you-4-star-posters... your thighs hates you. ATMOSPHERE: Lively. The restaurant features crazy American Kitzch, and has posters, bikes / mini airplanes and what not hanging from the ceilings, and an open floor plan which love it or hate it allows you to see and hear the entire dining room. FOOD: The burgers, fries, and most other dishes are really good. I can't say a word about the flavor, because it's delicious. What causes them to get ONE star only is the CALORIES in each and every burger you are consuming. Check their web page to verify (you have to really dig to find nutritional info - it's on the "FAQ" page), and read below to find out what you're eating: Gourmet Cheeseburger (ordered as-is) with fries - 1,250 calories and 1,750 grams of sodium A1 Peppercorn Burger (ordered as-is) with fries - 1,937 calories and 2,581 grams of sodium Whisky River SALAD (ordered as-is) - 1,799 calories and 2,385 grams of sodium These are examples - any "specialty" burgers or salads ramp up calories and heart stopping sodium contents by two, three, or even FOUR times the amount. COME ON PEOPLE!!!! Where I am not normally a freak about calories, I do like to be aware of what I'm eating, and when a restaurant so blatantly gorges its customers with unecessary and unhealthy choices, AND is so sneaky about hiding that fact, it p*sses me off.  Unless you want to blow up like a Macy's day parade balloon, indulge yourself elsewhere -this simply isn't worth it.

Overall it was a good experience, nothing too awesome but better than avg.  Atmosphere was good and clean and staff was pleasant.  Typical Red Robin atmosphere.  Our server forgot about us for a short time, but that didn't ruin the night.  Food was great, my burger was very tasty.  I just got a bacon cheeseburger and it was 3.75 stars,. (l am trying to avoid all the crazy burgers since I once got sick from one of them-that was at a different Red Robin tho.)  Fries were great too.  Drinks were very overpriced tho.  Not the best burger ever, but still a good option if you are in the area.

I can't believe how brain dead someone would have to be to give Red Robin a bad review because of calories. It's a burger place! The service here was great and the Berserker  burger was amazing. Too bad it's a special promotion and won't be around forever.

We go here often and have pretty good service.  Well, tonight our service was above and beyond and outstanding!  Thanks to Mike, our server!  And the food is always yummy in the tummy!  Good food with exceptional service...who wouldn't want to go. YUM!

Food is good. Minus French onion soup. It tasted like salt water. Service is terrible. Mcdonalds has less communication problems than this place. Our waitress lead off by telling us how exhausted she was and gave us false info about the bottomless sides. Not a big deal until the manager talked to us and said there's no way she made a mistake. He's a balding idiot and needs a mangers for dummies book.   He looks like greasey scumb bag that probably shouldn't work in the food industry. And to top it off when I went to the bathroom there is a giant rotting turd next to toilet.

It was great seeing a chain of hamburger restaurants serve vegetarian options, and they even offered the option of using lettuce as a substitution for the hamburger bun. The veggie burger though was slightly bland, and it seemed that the chef might not have been sure of how to season it. I ordered a Sangria, and I thought that I was drinking mostly soda, then any wine or alcohol. It was my first time ever trying Red Robin, and it was not disgusting, but it was not the greatest. It goes on the restaurants such as Chili's or TGI Friday's list.

Went here for lunch during the week.  Place wasn't very crowded but it was staffed like they were hoping it would be.  We were seated immediately and our waitress came up fast for our drink order.  Also, we never had to ask for refills, they would always show up right when we needed them. Everything came out quickly and on pace.  We asked for more fries and those came out very fast and hot. Service was good, would return if in the mood for a burger.

In an amazingly rare feat, the second batch fries were better than the first batch. That right there shows the commitment to excellence that this Red Robin staff embodies.  The new smoky pepper burger is definitely worth a shot. They say it's only available for a limited time, but if this reviewer had any say, it would be a staple.

Where do I even start with this place? Man. This was the most disappointing Red Robin experience I've ever had. When we first got here (there were 3 of us), they told us there was a 10 minute wait, which was fine with me. When we were seated the waitress didn't bring us water, we each had to individually ask for water. When we ordered, it took over 45 minutes to get our food. 35 minutes in, the waitress brought us a small batch of fries, "because their kitchen was backed up". It was a nice gesture, but couldn't she have done that like 25 minutes ago?? When our food finally came, it was...different than my past Red Robin experiences. I had already noticed that they changed their menu to make it incredibly complicated and hard to find items, but the food itself was different too. Instead of the normal plastic baskets, they came on red long plates that took up extra space, and my fries....what the heck?! There were about 10 fries in a tiny little metal cup. Okay, I get it. You're trying to up your "fanciness", but come on. You are RED ROBIN. No one's coming here for a fine dining experience. Not only were there barely any fries, they weren't garlic fries like I had ordered, so the waitress had to take them back, which meant once again, more waiting. Also, my boyfriend's fries didn't even come on his plate, which was so weird. Why did you bring out the plate if it wasn't ready? My burger was alright, I got the Shroom Burger. My boyfriend wanted the guacamole burger....but they ran out of guac. UHM. What?! She offered to put avocados on the burger instead, so he said alright, but it was pretty whack. My other friend got the Red Robin Tavern cheeseburger. His was the only order that stil came in the regular plastic basket and had everything that was supposed to be there. Anyway, when the server came back, I asked for a straw, and guess what? It never came. We were celebrating my boyfriend's early birthday (it was the next day), so my friend secretly told our server it was his birthday. While I was still eating my food and waiting for her to come back to order more fries, she all of a sudden shows up with this goopy, dripping, gross looking dessert. She then apologizes saying that they were out of ice cream, so they gave him soft serve. This was definitely not SOFT serve, it was MELTED serve! and it got EVERYWHERE. I wanted to try some, but I hadn't finished my meal, so by the time I was actually done, it was even more melted and more gross. The three servers (one being our server) that came over to sing the birthday song were so depressing. Our server was the only one who seemed like she cared and was genuinely happy. Another girl didn't even sing and had a frown on her face the entire time. The last girl sang, but looked like she hated everything. Overall, this was by far the worst experience I have ever had at a Red Robin and I'm upset with the direction in which they are choosing to take their food. I don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

One thing about Red Robin is you know what you are getting - very consistent food and hit or miss service. I think "Gourmet" is a stretch. Great variety of menu items and burger toppings, however, the the actual beef is average. I have had much better (Portillos) but have not found a really good burger in or around Gurnee.

Good food awesome milkshake our server jea mixed em just how we liked she was pleasant and very attentive  Even made great suggestions  Also knew the menu well and had greats ideas for add ons to our orders  I would def come back if only for Jea 's  Awesome service

The food was good, but service was a little spotty. Service was also a little pushy. They told us that it would be 35 minutes for food and asked what appetizer we wanted (not if, strictly which one). We skipped the appetizer and the food came hot and fresh in less than 20 minutes. While I was glad it came early, I am wondering if they just try to pull that to get you to order more. Overall, I would still probably go back for the food and atmosphere, but I am not so sure about the service.

Update. Tonight I was there for dinner and it was just alright. Not one of my better experiences at this location. My burger tasted over cooked and the fries were not very hot. Also my brother's meal was incorrect and the person that brought out the food could care less. Another thing I must add which really bothered me was the server towards the middle to the end of our visit. She seemed very quick to get us up and out the door. Not sure if she was done her shift for the night but she didn't remove any of our dishes and took our tip, which she was lucky to get a decent one, before we even left the table. I thought that was extremely rude and unprofessional. It shows that all you care about is our money. I work in the restaurant biz and know how Friday nights are when you just want to get out of there after a possible long shift. Overall, it was a so-so dinner. Nothing special.

I have eaten at 5 different locations and, much like the rest, this one was great! Fabulous waitress with amazing service. I was eating alone and she still visited my table frequently, kept my freckled lemonade full to the brim! Ordered a custom burger which came to me piping hot and perfect! Fun atmosphere, Large parking lot, kind of hard to get to but so worth it. Very clean. Restrooms were clean and didn't stink. So glad I stopped in on my little vacation!

I've regularly said that Red Robin is less about the burger and is more about the stuff they put on their burgers. Which is fine, but you need to be prepared for that going in. The burger itself isn't going to change your life. The food here is pretty good. Service is, as others have described, hit or miss. Tonight my plate was cleared from the table with half of a wrap still on it -- and that half of a wrap was never boxed up or brought back to me.  There are better places to get a burger in Gurnee -- or even on Grand Avenue -- but this is an okay option too.

Went on a Saturday night and was pleasantly surprised it was only a 10 minute wait for 4 of us. Waitress took our drink order right away. Delivered the kids drinks and we ordered appetizers.  Waitress deliveres the rest of our drinks and took our dinner order. Appetizers arrived about 5 minutes later. 20 minutes later the table next to us ( who were seated after us) received their food. We were told the kitchen was behind and or food would be out soon.After seeing several other tables who were seated after us get their food and even leave, we decided enough it's enough and asked for the check. The manager came over and apologized and said she could have or food out in five minutes. We had been waiting over an hour for a couple of burgers and they wanted its too wait more? Needless to say we left and we'll not be returning.

I usually love red robin. This was THE WORST experience ever. From the time we were seated we could tell the server wasn't interested. We had to get up to ask other staff for drink refills not once but twice! We were lucky she even came back to take our food order. She never once asked how our food was or if we needed anything.  Our plates sat there empty for well over 20 minutes. Two managers walked by, looked at our empty plates and had no concern. Never asked how everything was. This restaurant needs serious help. If red robin is spending all this money to update it they need to hire the right people to make sure they make their money back. Even better was listening to the bartender complain and 4 people getting yelled at in the kitchen. This was truly a horrible dining experience. We get one night to go out a week and this really left a horrible taste in our mouth. Service is key in a "SERVICE" related industry. We won't be retuning with plenty of other options in the area.

I love this joint!  Absolutely delicious burgers, cooked perfectly!  Incredibly attentive staff too!  I love their gluten free bun option, as well as the lettuce option.  Kids love coming here and we love the birthday burger months :)

I came here today after not coming for about a year or so. They changed the interior and such, but the service is still subpar. When we walked in we were not greeted, but was asked how many people. The lady who was going to seat us asked if we wanted a booth or just a table, we asked for a booth and she tried seating us in a very small booth. We asked for another one and asked if we can go on the other side of the restaurant where there was a lot of space, apparently they cleared out that area and no one is allowed to go there. So half of the restaurant is empty with a lot of space and so we just decided to sit at a table. We sat down and waited for her to give us menus. She came back with other people to sit them down at a table and gave them menus and totally forgets about us. We had to ask her for menus and she apparently didn't understand us and had some attitude look on her. When she came back with the menus she just gives it to us without apologizing or anything.  The reason why I chose to give two stars is because our server deserved that star. He did a good job in taking care of us and checked on us to see if we needed anything. If you get a server named Matt, tip him well. He made the night better overall.  But seriously Red Robin needs to step up there game on service.

They pay SUCH good attention to the gluten-free among us!!! I cannot remember when I last had french fries out. They have their own separate FRYER for g/f people. The burger was excellent, but the treat of the fires!!! OH MY.

Boy oh boy, this place has gone downhill fast. Each time I am here, it seems to be getting worse. Red Robin completed a renovation that transformed this restaurant (both in appearance and service). I'm not sure if they brought in new management but they quickly went from earning the hard-to-earn five star review to earning a measly two stars. Each time we are here, the service is so bad, I wanted to go into the kitchen and make the food myself. Not only is the service slow but it seems as though they don't want to wash their dishes. When you are done eating, you mine as well push the dishes off the table because they aren't going to take them from you. The food quality has dropped drastically. Every time I order a burger, I either receive the wrong food item or it isn't cooked properly (usually burnt to a crisp). The "bottomless" fries is practically the only thing that's good about this place but you are forced to ask for more, they do not ask you or offer them to you. They need new management and new employees. Corporate needs to re-evaluate this location because it has gotten way out of control. I will keep coming here because I love the concept and the All American Patty Melt but if this continues, they will lose a long-time customer.

Service is ok but real slow.  They could use a few more servers.  Management should pay more attention to other business and time of year for their scheduling.  Tuesday's is $5 movie night and no school.  Crazy busy.  Our server had at least 8-10 tables

Came here on a Monday night and had a fair amount of tables surrounding our booth.  We waited at least 10 minutes before we saw our waitress or any water after being seated right away. This didn't give a great first impression. I ordered the Whisky BBQ Burger (med-rare) with added Bacon. It was pretty good solid burger. No complaints here. The fries were decent too, although I'd prefer waffle or crispier fries over the steak fries. They have season salt at the table to put on the fries if you'd like.  My mom got the plain and simple burger with sweet potato fries, which she enjoyed and then got a box home. The sweet potato fries were good, except for the fact that they were cold upon arrival. :( This place is good for a quick meal, but isn't the best place out here in Gurnee.

I've given this place several second chances, but today's experience is the last straw. A friend and I came in for lunch. True to form, while the place was still half empty we were crammed between two sets of patrons sitting on a long cushion, so that we were treated to loud, stupid conversation a foot away on either side. Sorry, but this is how people in prison eat. As always, the service was extremely slow; it took more than ten minutes to get two glasses of water, and another fifteen or so before the order was taken. I ordered the whiskey burger, and it wasn't bad, but it and the fries were barely above room temperature. This is another constant at Red Robin, nearly-cold food.  Twenty minutes or so after we finished, we started looking around for someone to give us the check. Two people who had sat down next to us ten minutes earlier got up and left, absent even menus. They had the right idea. Never again. Spend your time and money just about anywhere else. Red Robin doesn't care about your business, so why give it to them?

I went to this location last night for dinner after a long day of walking/shopping around the mall. My friend & I decided to sit in the bar because the dining room was crazy & packed. After sitting down, we were immediately greeted by Zack who was working the bar. You know that feeling you get when you meet a genuinely good person & they also happen to be the person serving you? Zack was that guy. He working the bar alone (& I found he isn't even the normal bartender) & juggling everything with amazing grace. I mean he was taking orders, pouring drinks, making drinks for other servers, answering phones & bringing up to go orders but he did not miss a beat.  Due to Zack's friendly, good hearted nature & attentiveness I have left a 5 star rating. Our food was good but was pretty slow getting out. Our "appetizer" arrived at the same time our entrees did therefore kind of defeating the purpose of it. I will definitely be back & I really hope Zack will still be there to serve. He is an asset to your location & overall company. Job well done!

At this point, I know I look a little bipolar. I'm ok with that! After my daughter's begging, I gave in and went to Red Robin tonight. I wasn't too happy about it. I reluctantly ordered a burger and the waiter asked if I wanted my fries to be garlic parmesan. I choked out a, "No, I don't like them how they are now." as I reminisced about the deliciousness I've missed. But then a light appeared over the the waiter's head like an angel and he told me he could tell the kitchen to make me them the "old" way. I heard angels singing and life was good again. The end!

Always a disappointment at this location. Terribly slow service, rubbery veggie burgers, bad temperatures inside. I froze in the summer and they aren't very accommodating when you do say something. Kenosha's red robin is by far the best!

ONE STAR CANT GET LOW ENOUGH This review is more about what has happened to Red Robin, than my experience today, but today was the last straw.  I found myself on a lunch date with someone I had never met before, a new friend, and had  by far, the most unbelievably annoying, pushy, over-the-top flamboyant waiter I have experienced since my days of eating at a downtown trendy fern bar next to the Actors Studio.  Holy $&% was this guy ridiculous.  I won't shy from the ethnic or gay stereotype suggestions because he was a walking talking caricature of both.   Nothing but non-stop loud chatter in his fey ethnic / southern / Clark Street overdramatically happy pretentiousness, leaning in past what I would consider the personal space barrier, touching both our persons, then squatting down to breathe and spit on our silverware placed on a platter directly below his yapping mouth.  I literally saw some spray come from his yawning food shoot several times and was lucky enough not to feel it on my face.  I think THAT would have gotten me into a mode that would have ruined my date.   If that wasn't bad enough, he got THE ENTIRE ORDER WRONG.  Every item was wrong.  He was extremely nice, nothing negative about his behavior other than extremely overbearing, but he was pushy and almost authoritative, like being straight, going to La Cage Au Faux and being forced on stage with the cross dressers to be cowed into a chorus line.  It went on and on.  He kept coming back, apologizing for getting things wrong, then in a funny 'ha ha' way, twisted our arms to say something fake 'nice' about the service to the manager.   At one point after I had mentioned that I did not care for the specially salted French fries and my date complained about her salad, a rotund sweaty guy whose job it was to make nice with the complainers and give out free food cards, came over and squatted in the same way, yet another intrusion into our meal, meaty face and mouth, inches away from our food.  He apologized and asked us "What he could do to make it right" while Mr. shiny pants literally stood there right next to me, grandiosely clearing his throat like he was in a play, until we said something nice about the 'service.'  YES, I am not making this up.  We were 'forced' to say "Oh, but the service is excellent."  We lied.  Grandiosly. If I had been alone, I would have told him when he first walked up with the "Y'alls" and etc to "tone it down please" and then I would have escalated to "Get a manager over here" if he was not able to reign it in.  But this man was full bore bore.  He was outrageous and got everything wrong...a feat in itself, when all you serve is burgers and salads.  He never even asked for my level of doneness for my burger, nor the egg, which was runny and I did not want it that way, walking away after not only telling ME what I should have, but then also telling my new acquaintance, who then got what HE WANTED in a salad.   He literally talked over her as she was ordering and told her how "yummy this or that was" then brought her literally what he had suggested.  She complained kindly and that was his queue to go into apology mode, which was worse.  He tried to get her a new salad but she was in a hurry so could not wait (lunch break from work) for a new order, and then the show continued with the manager.  In all, about ten interruptions in all.  WOW.  Just wow.  What a freak show. He may be a great server and a really nice guy.  In fact, he seemed very nice.  But so over the top, so in-our-faces, that it was like he was on our date with us and was a third wheel we both were wishing was not with us.  I never even finished my burger.  I was too busy talking to him or the manager.  It was all about him.  All about our server and his need to be helpful.  He and the manager never even got that they would be ruining our meals by not leaving us the #^@! alone for a minute.  He brought the wrong fries, added the same wrong fries onto my plate, then after I kindly complained he brought out regular fries but left the ones on my plate.  He even knew about my dislike of all that salt and said that he accidentally placed the order for those fries on my plate, then fixed it NOT by taking them off my plate before they got to the table, but just bringing me regular fries.  And those were sub-par.  Dried out, overly salted, and over cooked.  It was like when Reni Santoni went yelling after Steve Martin's character in Dead Men Don't Wear Plaid "It's all right. It's just a bullet. My wife Carmelita will suck it out. Go ahead. And don't worry about your pajamas. I'll take care of them!"  It was comical.  HE was comical. I am done with Red Robin.

My family has visited this Red Robin twice now...both times on Sunday afternoon and both times the service was terrible.  Our first waitress seemed to hate her job and wasn't very pleasant, but at least our gluten free meals were, actually, GF.  Yesterday we had a very nice male server but it took 70 minutes from the time we sat to the time we were served.  Both GF buns were stale and had hard spots, my burger was over cooked, and both my daughter and I were sick by the time we got home with the symptoms we get from eating gluten.  There aren't many options for those with Celiac disease, and I'm very disappointed to think we are going to lose this option.  I hope the management at this location decides to do something about their Sunday staffing issues.
All I can say is terrible service.  Everytime! Not going back here ever. Just a bad overall experience.

Red Robin (Yum!) has fantastic burger choices. There's classic burgers, bacon burgers, vegi-burgers; you name it they have it. We entered the establishment and were seated immediately. The overall aesthetics of the place really make you feel comfortable when eating. I ordered the Bacon Burger, and my friend ordered the Guacamole Burger. My friend really enjoys pineapple so he asked for it on the Guacamole Burger and they did it with no problem! So don't be shy to ask for extras! As for the food. Oh my goodness. They burger was extremely flavorful and cooked to perfection. The steak fries taste amazing. It's also a plus that you can have as many fries as you want with their "Bottomless Steak-Fries". I highly recommend adding their seasoning to your meal too! Overall the service was great, the food was great, and the environment was great. If you want to have some good burger eats, hit up Red Robin for all your burger needs.
liked the tower of onion rings.   was not impressed by the burgers at all.  Floor was so slippery that day, everyone was sliding, but nobody was cleaning the grease off the floor

Gave a one because there isn't a zero. Been here a lot and have been very happy with the food and service. Today service was awful. Slow - surly - smelly. Our waitress had a huge e problem with BO. We had to ask several times for our drinks and the table near us had to ask more than once for mayo. A waitress tossed menus into a bin which spilled across the floor. She left them and walked away. It will take a lot to get us to come back.

Good food and drinks but the wait on our dinner took way too long and the appetizer dish was not properly washed (had a couple of stained spots). Plus the miscommunication between the waiters made it a little confusing on who was serving us... :-(

I must be losing brain cells as we have been here at least 5 times in the past year and the service has been horrible every time . Tonight we were told we couldn't have one basket of fries before our meals arrived. Ok, so we waited for our meals and ordered another basket of endless fries. Took 12 minutes and had roughly 15 fries in it. All of those fries for four meals. What a bargain. Second basket took about 17 minutes. It's not even busy right now. It's a common thing at RR to wait a long time for the bottomless fries.  Good food but the servers and management are about as useful as tits on a bull!!!

My husband and I attempted to stop at Red Robin Gurnee for a quick bite to eat before heading home to the western suburbs last night, 8/1/15 at 8:15pm. When we walked in, it should have been a red flag that there were so many un-bussed tables. We decided to give it a try anyways.  Our server promptly came to introduce herself, took our drink order and brought those back quickly. We then placed our food order- 2 cheeseburgers, nothing special, nothing fancy, and a side wedge salad. 15 min later the wedge salad arrived, no utensils, and no one around to flag down. After 10 minutes she returned, apologized and brought silverware. 45 minutes later, still no cheeseburgers. At this point in time, our 'quick stop' had taken well over an hour, and we still had no food. We flagged her down, alerted her that we would like to leave, asked for our bill, and she left. Finally after another 5 minutes, hubby put down some cash for the side salad and ice teas and we left.  After all that, we ended up at McDonald's drive through. Highly disappointed. Not sure if they were short staffed or what. Our server was friendly, but could have been more attentive to us versus her co-workers in the bar area, especially when it came to checking in and checking the status of our food.

Red Robin is a first time for us Texans. I came here with a party of 7 including 2 kids to lunch. We were seated right way.  There were so many burgers to choose from. After looking over the menu I decided on the Royal Red Robin Burger because of the egg. We also ordered the Onion Rings Rack. The Onion Rings was delicious. It was crispy and non greasy like others I've tried. The burger was flavorful and cooked just right. It was not dried at all. I also had a side of sweet potato fries and that was very delicious as well.  This experience was a great one.  We enjoyed our food and our waitress, Cassandra was wonderful. She was very friendly and gave us good recommendations on which burgers are good.

OH EM GEEE so I have been here like 5 effin times and like they take 20 minutes just to bring your drink. I know you gotta go help other tables but we're the only customers in here rn. The foods good but the service sucks.

The waiters were friendly, but to be frank, service is always everything. We were escorted to a booth that had food crumbs covering the seats and we had to personally wipe them down. In addition to that, all the menus given to us and the table was incredibly oily. I am not quite sure how long these menus have been around or have been taken care of, but I didnt like the feeling of oil buildup on my hands while trying to find an entree. The wait time for the food was also ridiculously long. Business was slow but the food wait was just as slow. I had ordered the Geniysis burger, which was good, but the chicken tortilla soup my father ordered was definitely not tortilla soup. It didn't look anything like the pictures. It didn't look good, or taste good.

Service was okay, but the food was just awful! I'd ordered their Seafood Scatter and everything was overcooked. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed well done, cooked food, but this was to the point where it's bitter! Maybe it's my own fault for ordering fish and chips at a place known for burgers.

Went on Monday at 12:15pm and was surprised they were not to busy, we were seated right away. The waitress was friendly and was quick too.   The food came quickly and was pretty good. I got the brat and was made to order.   Really no complaints but i was kind of surprised that a brat was $10. I guess you are paying for the endless fries. So make sure you eat a lot of them.

Food was good.  Service was good.  I tipped accordingly.  Missed the line item on my check.  $1.99 entertainment fee.  I answered a couple trivia questions, probably missed some fine, very fine, print.  Was charged to touch the screen on the table top device.  Really?

Service and food is normally pretty good. One time had either a new manager or one that didn't know what they were doing. Would not give table while rest of party was on the way (2 of the 4 people were there....) and the place was half empty, so I have no idea what his deal was.

Is the dish washer broken at this location? Every plate and utensil were greasy and the table sticky. I asked for new plates and the waitress never even brought them out. We ate the apps off of napkins. The restaurant was not busy when we went there but the wait staff came across as rushed and put out. An older male server brought our food out to us and was rude and annoyed when we asked for additional napkins since we had to use ours as plates. We would much rather order everything from the table top computer (if it had worked) than have to deal with the staff and the tip reflected it. The bathrooms were disgusting as well. Heading to the Lincolnshire location next time.

Off day for red robbin today. The hosts looked lost and frantic (there were 2 hosts). When I arrived they kept telling me to wait 1 second but it didn't seem busy. The servers were also horrible, no small talk, no greeting. Food took a while to arrive. The mgr tried her best to check on us several times but we're definitely  not coming back to this red robbin.

Wow, has this place gone downhill.  We had lunch there yesterday and not much went well.   Our server was triple sat, so she was slow in greeting us.   Upon doing so, she ordered our Onion rings from the kiosk at the table, because that "made it easy for her".      The onion rings arrived, warm at best, without the side of honey mustard we ordered.   We ordered a turkey burger to split.  Usually when we do this, it comes out pre-cut on 2 plates.   Nope...not this time.  The burger was dropped off by someone else, who wasn't concerned.  We quickly found out, after the first bite, that the burger was beef.   We sat there for minutes waiting for our slammed server to check in.   She apologized, saying a manager would be by soon.   Next she dropped off some cold fries for us to munch on.  When the the next burger was done was when we saw the manager.  We couldn't gulp down this $11 burger fast enough to just get out of there.  I know Red Robin is attempting to reinvent itself, but they're heading in the wrong direction with experiences like this.  It's going to be a while before I consider them for a dining option.

This Red Robin is the worst I've ever been to. Not only was the food undercooked, they charged us for two appetizers we didn't even order. The manager stated they couldn't reverse the charges and offered up a gift card for the cost of the appetizers. We accepted. The part that ticked me off? Went to another location and tried to pay with the gift card and it had a zero balance!! The jerk manager lied to us and took our money!!!

Well, after my initial Yelp review Red Robin's customer service reached out to me to find out what happened and to forward my information to the Red Robin in Gurnee. They also were kind enough to send over a small gift card for a free meal so I could at least give them another chance.  Admittedly, I still don't think I'd go back to the Gurnee restaurant but was willing to try out the Red Robin in Deer Park.  They were MUCH better food quality and service wise.  I'm bumping up my review to 3 stars just for their fantastic customer service and the fact the rest of the chain seems alright :)

Always a poor experience at this location. If the food isn't cold, the service is always slow. Tonight 12/29, waited for over 20 minutes for our table that would take only "10-15 minutes, they're just wiping it off now". When we asked about our table, the guy that took my name down said that he didn't know what happened or where our 'reservation had disappeared to.' Save your time and go somewhere else.

Was hesitant about going back to this place, but thought I'd give it another chance since I was contacted by management apologizing for what had happened. I appreciated to hear back from them in wanting to fix the situation. Went back there on Sunday the 17th around 7.30 pm. We had Will for our waiter and he did everything right. We didn't really have to ask him much, he took care of us and I was pleasantly pleased. Food was great and so was the service. Looks like management did take some of my feedback into consideration. After the past review giving them a low rating, I'm changing it to 5 stars. I'm a happy customer and if it continues to be like this, I'm more than likely to go back again.

I go to Red Robin often because my best friend and I meet at one about every 2 months to catch up back where I'm from (California). I always order the same thing and the service is usually pretty good. Not amazing, but definitely above average. I have been to this location 3 times since recently moving here and have had issues every single time. Not only do they serve my meal wrong every time, but the server is typically absent most of the time.  The first time, we had to wait a very long time for the food and also the beverages. My husband ordered a beer and we eventually had to go to the bar to order it because it never came.  The second time, we had a server who was clearly new which is usually fine except that this time the food took so long coming out and she didn't update us at all until we had to stop her as she walked by to inquire about it. Our food finally came out, but not at the same time... All four of us got our meal at different times, and it was 15 minutes between the first one that came out and the last. The manager apologized to us (we didn't complain too much to her though, we're really not those kinds of people) and also got us a beer because it took so long for it to get to us.  The third time, I got a side of mac and cheese that literally made me feel sick. I didn't realize that that's what was making my stomach turn until my husband asked why I wasn't eating the rest of my food. I told him to try the mac and cheese and he was disgusted, he said you could taste that it had been in the fridge too long. I felt sick the rest of the night.  We have finally decided that we will no longer be going to this Red Robin which makes me sad because I love Red Robin.

The one star is for the service we received tonight. After my son basketball game we thought we treat him to Red Robin. We were sat right away but then no one for 12 minutes. We then on the Ziosk we pushed call server and took 8 minutes for someone to notice and it flashes red. It was not even our server and she let us know that. She took our drink order and again no one then same server  came and said I don't know who your server is but let me take your order at least. Sad part is a women who looked like the manager walked by us a few times. We received our food and ordered 3 meals and when came time for refill on fries for all of us they only brought one order for all of us to share witch was about 4 fries person. Finally our server came and acted like everything was fine. Very hard to undo our night especially since I wanted to treat my son to this place after a victory. Jan.22 came in here cause my son really wanted to have it. They did a better job with service. Jen did a great job even though it is very busy. The burger this time just a little more grease then before but not the worst thing since I have a napkin. Since was busy the table and floors not cleaned as good.

We walked in at 4:00 PM on a Saturday and were seated fairly quickly.  It took well over 10 minutes to have a server greet us and get our drink order.  She was extremely pleasant, but it appeared to us that they may have been understaffed.  My wife mentioned early into the visit that the women's bathroom was filthy and out of soap.  As we departed an hour later, the bathroom was in the same condition.  We aren't sure how the staff was properly cleansing as they were seen using the restroom.  Our food, 2 burgers (medium) and a crispy chicken sandwich took over 30 minutes to arrive at the table, were barely warm and toppings as ordered were not correct.  As we mentioned the bathroom issue again on the way out, we were met with an unenthusiastic greeter with hygiene issues.  She was not interested in the complaint and turned to work on another task as we walked out.

Dissapointed how this RR is run. Have been a bunch of times and doesn't compare to the one in Lincolnshire. Never had any issues in Lincolnshire but Gurnee is much different.  Saturday- Waited 20-30 mins with many open tables. Told them 2 adults 1 high chair they wrote down 3. Sat us in a booth in high traffic area. The chair was in the way for everyone. 2 empty tables next to us out of the way. Literally over 10 minutes until waitress showed up. Took forever to get food. Never refilled Tea. Got order wrong.  Should have asked for manager but never even saw one.  They need to get this place in order!!

Red Robin has always been a go-to burger joint. I have tried multiple burgers from here and each one has been great. The fried mushroom, cheese sticks and marinara sauce were very good and my daughter and niece enjoyed their "waiting until lunch" appetizers... My family was traveling through and decided to stop at the Gurnee Mills exit because it is our half way point. The food was great but the waitresses service was bad. The hostess was so friendly and made sure my daughters booster seat was securely fastened before leaving the table. The waitress however could not focus, kept looking around when ordering, forgot to bring this or that out. The other waitress near our table brought our food out and provided us with refills because as she noted we had been waiting for sometime. At one point I looked up and our server was just staring off. On top of that seating is VERY tight, we might as well just sat with the tables on either side of us.

This restaurant has really gone down. Look at this awful salad... half the ingredients were missing. Had to have the waiter bring them afterwards. Wilted lettuce and terrible presentation... even the kids meals were skimpy and terrible.

Wish I could give this place a zero.  Love Red Robin, but this place is horrible.  Do not waste your time or money.  Burgers and fries were all cold, like they had them in a refrigerator.  Really friggin cold.  Don't ask for some pink in the burger, my wife's burger came out raw.  Good thing about the whole experience was the manager did not charge us at all.

Been coming here on and off ever since they opened. It was great at first but then started to notice the place going downhill. The food is fine. The problem is their service. Wait times seem to be longer even when the place is not busy, waiters/waitresses seem to be "all-over-the-place" and not focused on their tables, lots of forgotten orders, and no refills.

Very disappointed with our service and the food from our visit tonight.  8:00 on a wednesday night.  Our food took over 30 minuets to arrive.  When I asked our waitress where our food was, she said that she just checked and it was not up yet.  So while we were still waiting for our food, I asked for some coffee.  When the waitress brought me the coffee, it was cold.  I told her that it was cold and her response was, "I did not make the coffee."  and walked away. That was not the correct response.  She should have at least offered to get me another cup!  When our food finally arrived, it was mediocre.  Nothing to get excited about.  I asked for more steamed broccoli.  It came out cold!  When the waitress finally came back over, I said to her, "I know that you did not make the broccoli, but it's ice cold!"  she walked away without saying a word.  She finally brought me another broccoli.  This one was warm, yeah!  I asked her if she would please bring me a hot cup of coffee even if she had to put it in the microwave.  Finally warm coffee!  A quick trip to the restroom was the last straw!  I asked to speak to the manager.  The restroom was DESTROYED! It was obvious that none of the staff had attended to it for hours, the garbage cans were over flowing.  So I asked to speak with the manager.  I told him all about or visit, and the condition of the bathroom.  I was told that they, "are working thru some things".  Not exactly sure what that means, but we will never be back.  There are many other choices in this area that we will visit instead.

I tried RedRobin for the first time ever and was impressed with their burger and most importantly customer service. However I'm not so crazy about their fruit that you can get on the side so I will try their french fries next time.

I decided to try the Mad Love burger on a ciabetta bun.  My friend chose chicken on a ciabetta bun.  Both of our sandwiches were on a seeded and very soggy bun.  We were told they didn't have any ciabetta buns because they ran out. Fries were cold..very unusual.  This is the second time in two weeks that something was wrong with the order.  Manager, whom another lady was waiting for also, couldn't be located.  When this place first opened, it was great.  Now, it doesn't appear clean, the service leaves much to be desired, and we never get.what we order.  I guess we'll be looking for a different place to eat.

I've been to multiple Red Robins. This is the worst that I've been too. While we were seated right away (a table of 9) it took quite some time for our server Carrie to get to our table. We had silverware before our server even greeted us. We ordered our drinks, appetizer and dinner at the same time. (That just shows you how long we waited). Our appetizer arrived before our drinks. I asked for water that I never received. The food was good as were the drinks. The atmosphere was dull. The service leaves a lot to be desired.

About a year ago I said never again to Red Robin gurnee. That time I was served ice cold food and asked for a new plate, which came, tepid. We never got our fries on that visit, but not for asking several times.  Flash forward to today. Our server was nice but clearly overloaded. It took 20 minutes for her to greet us and 31 minutes just to get our drinks. They had a French fry problem and suggested other sides for quicker service, we got onion rings. You guessed it, they came cold. Our server got us a new plate of them quickly, but how hard can it be to get warm fries/ onion rings? This place makes it look like an impossible feat. We asked for a to go box which we abandoned after 6 minutes of waiting.

It was an interesting experience to say the least. We were ready to order and our waitress told us we had to wait so she could take a different tables order and was snippy about it so didn't love that. Food was meh. Only thing I'll ever come here for is the blue moon shakes

When you go to Red Robin you don't expect much, however you do expect to see the waiter every 10 min or so - not here. 15-20 mins between visits and then when we asked for mustard we ended up getting it ourselves - guy finally came back but too little - too late.  We came here for my grandsons 5th birthday on a Wed evening - lots of empty tables. Waited forever for additional drinks and then had to ASK (3rd time) for the Birthday song.  Never again.

My first experience at Red Robin was in Indianapolis, IN with my mother-in-law and Grandmother. The food was delicious, I enjoyed it so a colleague and I went last week to the location in Lincolnshire again the food was DELICIOUS!. This past Saturday, I treated my children to dinner and chose to take them to Red Robin in Gurnee, IL.... The worst experience I have had. I specifically told the server that I was allergic to cheese and to ensure that the they did not add cheese to my burger. She bring me my plate and bleu cheese stacked on my burger. My 21 year old and my daughter both ordered the chili burger and specifically asked for their burger to be cooked well done. They bit into their burger and it was medium rare. We would ask the waitress for refills and never received it. I walked up to the hostess and asked if she could get someone to get our refills. My 7 year old and 12 year old had the mini corn dogs and they were burnt. My seven year old said mommy I can not eat that because its too hard. That was my children first time eating Red Robins and they left with a bad impression. I know that the food and service is good at the prior two locations I ate at but will never go back to the location in Gurnee. They really need to be revamped because the service and food suck.They really need to step up their game because they make Red Robin look bad. However I will eat Red Robin only when i am traveling or in my office in Lincolnshire.

Don't waste your time coming here. Look for something anywhere other than here. The staff was friendly enough, but they oddly seated us much too close to other guests, uncomfortably close, which was an obvious problem with them as well as you could over hear them talking about how close they were to everyone else even though the restaurant was empty??? It was so cold in there I regretted not bringing my parka. They were out of the two appetizers we ordered??? The food wasn't very good at all, it was sloppy, room temperature, and just not enjoyable. Needless to say I will not be coming back.
Josh was amazing. The Billion Dollar baby burger with a fried egg. He is the best here hands down. Do not go anywhere but here, and see only Josh.

This location has gone downhill fast.  Last night was the last time I will go here.  The food was as expected, and the service was fine, but we were given a hard time for wanting a kids meal for my 12 year old daughter, you can no longer start with fries while you wait (even though they are unlimited with all our orders) and the women's bathroom was appalling.  Worse than many gas station bathrooms!   With so many restaurant choices in the area, you would think they would try to stay competitive to draw people in.  My kids loved going there for the fries, and it is one of the few places my 12 year old vegetarian likes to go.  But we all agreed after last night that we won't be back.
Waitress was great. Food was not good. Asked for fries well done as they are always undercooked. Still came out undercooked.
Love Red Robin. I always have great service and great food! Love my Royalty card! I always get emails for specials and I have no problem redeeming the specials when I pay.

Awesome service! This guy is on point!! I was seated immediately, ordered, and received my food (and Beer) within 10 minutes. The burger (Fiery Ghost) was very good, but alas... the Beer was better (sorry, I love Beer). Kudos to this location.

Terrible Service. This review is only after having had three bad experiences here. This past one took the cake. The waiter was new, his name is Marc-Anthony. He made excuse after excuse the entire time. My husband didn't receive his food until after our group had already finished theirs. Marcs excuse was that the kitchen was backed up. Clearly he had just forgotten to put our order in, and instead of fessing up to it, he blamed it on the kitchen. When he finally remembered he'd forgotten an order, he tried to remember what we ordered instead of asking us, so when he served the food, the order was wrong. Not to mention we paid an upcharge for bottomless sweet potato fries and we only received one order after asking over and over again for another order. We were out celebrating my son's birthday and we ordered ice cream, by the time it was served to us, it was melted! How long was it sitting out before it was served to us? We also weren't given any napkins at a table full of kids! The waiter, Marc, also never gave us refills on our drinks. This is a major problem on behalf of the managers, because this guy clearly was not ready to be on the floor, as this is a training issue. The waiter is also responsible, because the first rule of thumb for anyone in customer service, is never make excuses or blame other people. Always take accountability, it's more respectable and customers are easier to understand. This was a special occasion for my young son, and this waiter made it a terrible experience. I give one star, because I like the food, but poor customer service far outweighs the quality of the food.

It became extremely busy a few minutes after we were seated. Our waiter Michael gave us outstanding service and attention even though he went up to 7 tables in 15 minutes. Our food arrived 10 minutes after we ordered it and was exactly right. The root beer refill came before the food. The unsalted fries refill came quickly. We were out within 40 minutes. All of the food was great, and the server was unusually good to carry off what he did.

Red Robin has contacted us and I feel they have been very sincere in their response. We appreciate a company reaching out to us and handling the situation in an extremely professional manner. Kudos to them for doing this. I wish more companies would have the same level of professionalism that they have shown.

Every time I have gone the service has been great. Even with the small mistakes they make, they always fix them if you ask with no charge! The food is also great- get the Whiskey River BBQ Burger! One time I was here, I was with a large group of people, and the waitress tried carrying too much water on a tray. She spilled the whole tray of water on my poor friend's mother. However, the waitress apologized profusely and they did not charge my friend's mom for her meal. That was the worst experience there, and yet they still handled it well. I love this location, and I'll continue coming here often!

MEDIOCRE FOOD, MISERABLE SERVICE.  Party of 4 seated immediately. Waited a bit for drink order to be taken (3 waters, 1 beer). Drinks arrived in a reasonable amount of time but then we waited over 10 minutes for the server  to return for our food order. She finally came without offering an apology for the long wait. Food arrived in a reasonable amount of time but 1 burger arrived as a completely different  burger.  We informed the manager and then the server took it away and it took about 10 minutes for the correct burger to arrive. Meanwhile,  I ordered a Cobb salad which ended up with not 1,  but 2 lettuce large butts/stems in it. I set them aside and informed the server. She took them and said she told the manager to come speak with us. He never did.  Server then came with check and said that she had asked the manager 2 times to come over to our table.  On our way out, we saw manager near hostess stand and we told him about our poor experience and he said that the server never told him about coming over to our table regarding the issues with our meal (because there's 2 other managers working).  No resolution or compensation was offered.  Unacceptable.  We won't return again.
Food sucked and service was terrible wouldn't spend $12 for a burger there again done with this place!!

I was there last night and our waitress, Adriana, she is one of the best and friendliest waitresses I've ever served by. She was quick and attentive. Waitressing must not be easy but she was really good at it!  Dinner was delish too.

Went out for lunch With my Boyfriend and were debating on where to go we finally decided to eat here and while i was enjoying my delicious cheeseburger a spider crawled from under my plate! I was terrified! I didn't say anything but if i wouldn't have noticed, it could have crawled into my food.

We have gone to Red Robin quite a few times over the last bunch of years.  Sad to say it appears their quality is slipping - at least at the Gurnee location... Issue 1:  on a not so busy night seated a table with an older child and two older adults next to two different large groups of small screaming kids.  Really?  You couldn't seat us on the other side of the room where the rest of the adults were? Issue 2:  service (or more accurately) lack of it...  our server was sure jumping and serving one table next to us, but did not even bother to check on us.  I tried several times to get his attention to no avail...  perhaps all the screaming kids drowned out my voice? Maybe so - but I can't imagine they impeded his vision...  felt like he did not see what he did not want to see. Issue 3: listening is a skill?  When you ask questions about something you're ordering you've never had before, it is very helpful you understand what's being asked to ensure you answer the question.  The menu was so full of choices I was trying to understand the differences - and thought I had after talking to the server.  Nope - the sandwich was not what I expected to get...  whose fault?  Should I have more carefully read the menu?  Or should the server been more descriptive about what I was ordering?  Most other restaurants I go to take the time to educate me - apparently not at Red Robin... Issue 4:  should I pay more for the extra bits of food and other nasty "gunk" that's left on the silverware?  Red Robin is not cheap ~ maybe that's why?  Could they have paid the dishwasher a couple extra dollars to do a better job? Issue 5:  we love our "guests"...  they say so, but I'm not sure I feel the love...  from the manager to corporate guest services, I'm not very confident they see the way things are from my perspective.  "We're sorry, we'll fix it, come back soon!" doesn't really feel very sincere...   There's too many good dining choices in the area to run a restaurant like this.  I hope Red Robin listens to their customers (there some great feedback in these reviews)- I'd really hate to see them go because they were unwilling to believe they need to make improvements.

I've been to this location before and haven't had an issue but last night was an exception. My daughter had a coupon for a free birthday burger of her choosing. She ordered one on a gf bun, with sweet potato fries and I had a simple chicken sandwich, since I was just along to be transpiration.... When the check came, my $8.99 sandwich has been comped and her burger was left on the bill for $13.48 plus tax. The server stated that she couldn't control what comes off the bill. The manager was called over and he stated the same thing and when I told him that I wasn't going to accept that, he said that he'd give me $3 is cash if it's a really big deal. Yes. This is a big deal. Is this the actual policy? If so, please change the wording on the coupon that is sent out, specifically naming the birthday person, stating that their burger will be free. There is quite a disconnect here. Not cool Red Robin.

Good food and good service at this location. We abandoned the Lincolnshire location due to poor service. Sad they discontinued the boca burger but now have a bean burger that is ok. Please offer more vegan options here in the future! This location is always busy and there may be a wait so go early. We will drive the extra 20 minutes for better service! Speaking for my husband, he is happy with the burgers and service.

Haven't been a fan of Red Robin because of customer service at other locations, but this location did a fantastic job.  They were also very accommodating with rewards, as well as making sure my toddler was good to go.

My review may be a little biased because I was here on Black Friday - just a heads up. My friend and I came to have lunch here around 12ish. We were in seated in the bar area, which we were totally okay with. I've been to Red Robin before and I'm usually a huge fan of the burgers and fries. It did not disappoint as per usual - I got the guacamole bacon burger! I also asked for our fries before receiving the burgers to snack on. We also ordered an onion ring tower. We were a little too ambitious.. we didn't think 3 onion rings would be enough for each of us if we ordered the small tower, but we could not finish the large one at all! The onion rings are made so perfectly here - I just have to cut them in half, otherwise I end up having to put the whole thing in my mouth. Aside from the food, the customer service was rather slow. I wouldn't even say that it was really busy... I just didn't feel like we got checked on enough. We waited for quite some time when we were done eating our food to be able to get to-go boxes and pay for our meal. Overall, it was an okay experience at this location. Parking is spacious!

Great food! The service could be a little more attentive. My family came in and our food was great we just had to hunt down our server for refills on our drinks. Luckily one of the managers came by she was super sweet and refilled all our drinks and even checked up on us before we left.

The place is extremely cold, one need to eat with the jacket on, the temperature inside is close to 60F. Service is slow and the servant hard to get her attention. Overall not a good place to have lunch

Here  with a few first timers and the food is exactly what we were looking to eat!! Each of the five at the table all order a different type of burger and the burgers were amazing!!  The server was very friendly and helpful and we came in the store 15 minutes before the store closed- you would expect the staff to be a bit put out that we rolled in so late but they were not!!!! Give this place a go!!
